subject: Law
title: The Duty to Zealously Advocate
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Duty to Zealously Advocate.

hook.text: A defense lawyer believes her client is guilty. She still fights for acquittal. Isn't that wrong? Ethics say no.

buildup.text: Lawyers must advocate zealously within the bounds of the lawâ€”even for clients they personally disagree with.

discovery.text: The adversarial system depends on both sides arguing their best case. Truth emerges from the clash of arguments.

twist.text: Zealous advocacy has limits. Lawyers cannot lie to the court, fabricate evidence, or help clients commit fraud.

climax.text: John Adams defended British soldiers after the Boston Massacre. Unpopular clients still deserve representation.

punchline.text: Everyone deserves a lawyer. Even the guilty. Especially the guilty.

quiz.question: What are the limits of zealous advocacy?
options: Lawyers cannot lie to the court or help clients commit fraud
Lawyers must agree with their client's actions
